title: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
description: Bug 21706BidiUtil in win32 has Class.forName() usage
OB:
The observed behavior is that the code in org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil includes a line: static Callback callback = new Callback (BidiUtil.class, "windowProc", 4);
However, this code is causing a NoClassDefFoundError in the CLDC version of SWT. This error is not defined in the CLDC class libraries.
EB: The expected behavior is that the code in org.eclipse.swt.internal.BidiUtil should be modified to remove the reflection and avoid the NoClassDefFoundError.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Verify or use jxeLink or a similar approach.
2. Compile the code using the Eclipse compiler or Sun's compiler.
3. Observe that the compiler does not generate an error, but the NoClassDefFoundError is encountered at runtime in the CLDC version of SWT.

To resolve the issue, change the line mentioned above to:
static Callback callback = new Callback (new BidiUtil().getClass(), "windowProc", 4);
Note: This change has not been tested, but it should provide the same functionality.
